review_text: Came here for a quick lunch with the folks and sister. Didnt realize it was much more of a bar with seating in the back than a full restaurant with a bar. But it has good yelp reviews, so there we were. Inside, its really pretty with velvet wallpaper and old wood. No drinks for us this day but the food was pretty solid. For appetizer we shared the flatbread grilled with mozzarella, cherry tomatoes, arugula, and balsamic. Light and tasty - a good start to the meal. I had the three sliders - burger, crab cake, and shrimp. They asked me how Id like my burger slider cooked. Kind of an unexpected sophistication for a humble slider. And it came out as asked. The shrimp were plump and juicy and tasted real good in between the buns. And the buns were soft brioche and not stale as I feared. The crab cake was a bit disappointing since it wasnt really lump - but it didnt claim to be either. The sliders came with hand cut fries that were like Belgian frites.  Sis got the salmon - didnt try it but everyone said it was quite good. My parents shared the goddess salad. The server was more than happy to split it in the back for us - always a plus since some places are weird about that. The salad was very fresh with a variety of components. They opted to get it with grilled chicken. On the whole everyone enjoyed their meal. I think even more so because these food wasnt as salty as typical restaurants. These servers were pleasant but the dish clearing was a little aggressive, especially considering the place was only half full. Three entrees plus appetizer for lunch came out to around $70 + tip. High, but not terrible considering its Manhattan. Definitely a place worth checking out.
